meanings.sent1: I will phosphatize the soil to help the plants grow better.
meanings.sent2: The scientist decided to phosphatize the water to study its effects on marine life.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally phosphatized the sugar instead of the salt in the recipe.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to phosphatize the room, brightening everyone's mood.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes phosphatized the canvas, bringing the painting to life.

meanings.definition: To treat or impregnate with a phosphate compound.
meanings.sent1: The company will phosphatize the metal to prevent rusting.
meanings.sent2: It is common practice to phosphatize seeds before planting them.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand seemed to phosphatize everything it touched, turning objects into phosphorus.
meanings.sent4: Her words phosphatized his thoughts, leaving a lasting impact on his mind.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight phosphatized the leaves, giving them a shimmering appearance.
